channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 周四晚，墨西哥警察在该国西部地区枪杀了一名乡村师范学院的学生。这名 23 岁的受害者就读于同一所学校，2014 年有 43 名学生被绑架。
item.description:
Mexican police officers shot and killed a student from a rural teachers college on Thursday night in the western part of the country. The 23-year-old victim was enrolled at the same school that 43 students attended before they were abducted in 2014. https://t.co/ke0CUAMVbU

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 10, 2024

item.title: 联合国人权事务负责人周五谴责以色列计划在被占领的约旦河西岸新建 3000 多座定居者房屋，并警告说定居点扩张等同于战争罪。
item.description:
The United Nations human rights chief on Friday condemned Israeli plans to build more than 3,000 new settler homes in the occupied West Bank, warning that settlement expansion amounts to a war crime. https://t.co/eJ0Sqt6r23

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 9, 2024

item.title: 饥荒正困扰着加沙，但美国领导的倡议面临着巨大的障碍，包括后勤、安全和成本。
item.description:
Famine is stalking Gaza, but the American-led initiative faces daunting obstacles, including logistics, security and cost. https://t.co/ztkwOxKLb1

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 9, 2024

item.title: 几十年来，中国的独生子女政策一直贯穿于日常生活的方方面面。现在，面对人口的萎缩和老龄化，中国政府正在利用许多相同的宣传渠道传递相反的信息：多生孩子。
item.description:
For decades, China's one-child policy was woven into the fabric of everyday life.

Now, faced with a shrinking and aging population, the government is using many of the same propaganda channels to send the opposite message: Have more babies. https://t.co/aaeZB8dn4S

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 9, 2024

item.title: 爱尔兰选民否决了对该国宪法的两项修改建议，这两项建议将删除有关妇女在家庭中职责的措辞，并扩大婚姻以外的家庭定义。
item.description:
Voters in Ireland have rejected two proposed changes to the country’s Constitution that would have removed language about women’s duties being in the home and broadened the definition of family beyond marriage. https://t.co/xe4TkRejUP

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 9, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯军队在攻占乌克兰阿夫迪耶夫卡后的几天内迅速取得进展，但在附近三个村庄的进攻却陷入停滞。
item.description:
After making rapid gains in the days following the capture of Avdiivka, Ukraine, Russian military assaults have stalled around three nearby villages. https://t.co/n6FvhBVqSy

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 9, 2024

item.title: 随着亚马逊地区各国与极端天气引发的创纪录数量的火灾作斗争，数百平方英里的亚马逊雨林被烧毁。
item.description:
Hundreds of square miles of the Amazon rainforest have burned as countries in the region battle a record number of fires fueled by extreme weather. https://t.co/HI6MpJjFDC

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 9, 2024

item.title: 死在加沙的 10 岁男孩亚赞-卡法尔内（Yazan Kafarneh）的骷髅图像在社交媒体上广为流传，成为该飞地严峻食品状况的生动警示。
item.description:
The harrowing image of a skeletal Yazan Kafarneh, a 10-year-old boy who died in Gaza, has circulated widely on social media and served as a graphic warning about the enclave’s dire food situation. https://t.co/nR5p2lD8Wo

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 9, 2024

item.title: 受到伦敦西北部米凯拉中学等学校成功学业的启发，一些校长开始对学生的行为进行严格控制。
item.description:
Inspired by the academic success of schools like the Michaela secondary school in northwest London, some principals are introducing tight controls on students’ behavior. https://t.co/31QmgSbwgC

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 9, 2024

item.title: 新闻分析：拜登总统决定通过空运和海运向加沙运送援助物资，这是由日益严重的人道主义危机引发的转变。但这也对美国的角色提出了令人不安的问题。
item.description:
News Analysis: President Biden’s decision to send aid to Gaza by air and sea represents a shift prompted by the growing humanitarian crisis. But it raises uncomfortable questions about America’s role. https://t.co/hGMI0LN4bc

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 9, 2024

item.title: 阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的团队在反对党领袖的遗孀尤利娅-纳瓦尔娜娅身上找到了新的领导者。但保持政治势头将是一项挑战。
item.description:
Aleksei Navalny’s team has found a new leader in the opposition leader’s widow, Yulia Navalnaya. But maintaining political momentum will be a challenge. https://t.co/7ay7QJTCr7

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 9, 2024

item.title: 新闻分析：德国的奥拉夫-肖尔茨和法国的埃马纽埃尔-马克龙之间的关系最近变得尖锐，在关键时刻威胁到欧洲的团结。
item.description:
News Analysis: The relationship between Olaf Scholz of Germany and Emmanuel Macron of France has recently turned bitter, threatening European unity at a critical moment. https://t.co/opZIwQMAlz

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 9, 2024

item.title: 在英国，新开了一大波出售纽约式百吉饼的店铺，与伦敦的同类产品相比，纽约式百吉饼更大、更硬、更有风味。但是，一些传统主义者仍然坚持伦敦的 "贝果"。
item.description:
There’s a wave of new shops in Britain selling New York-style bagels, distinct for being bigger, doughier and more heavily seasoned than their London counterparts. But some traditionalists are standing by the London “beigel.” https://t.co/gRPMc3yhg6

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 9, 2024

item.title: 英国前首相特雷莎-梅将在下届大选中离开议会。由于保守党在民调中严重落后，她是保守党约 60 名议员中宣布下台计划的资历最深的一位。
item.description:
Former Prime Minister Theresa May is to leave the UK Parliament at the next election. With the Conservative Party trailing badly in the polls, she is the most senior of its approximately 60 lawmakers who have announced plans to step down. https://t.co/zr7gUUoj1c

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 英超最佳球员不是你想的那个人。
item.description:
The best player in the Premier League is not who you think it is. https://t.co/ggItE8YGwx

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 拜登总统在国情咨文中概述了美国建造浮动码头通过海路向加沙运送援助物资的计划，并敦促以色列采取更多措施解决该地区的人道主义灾难。
item.description:
In his State of the Union address, President Biden outlined U.S. plans to build a floating pier to deliver aid to Gaza by sea and pressed Israel to do more to address the humanitarian catastrophe in the territory. https://t.co/OmBMxg8SX1

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 救援组织说，繁琐的新战略无法取代以色列允许更多的补给卡车进入加沙地带。
item.description:
Relief organizations say cumbersome new strategies cannot substitute for Israel allowing more supply trucks into the Gaza Strip. https://t.co/9vybNP25hk

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 加沙当局称，周五，空投的人道主义援助物资掉落在加沙城，造成至少五名巴勒斯坦人死亡，数人受伤。
item.description:
The authorities in Gaza said at least five Palestinians were killed and several others were wounded on Friday after packages of humanitarian aid that had been airdropped fell on them in Gaza City. https://t.co/4iE4HURqcR

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 照片记录了帮派暴力如何使海地陷入最严重的混乱时期。
item.description:
Photographs document how gang violence has plunged Haiti into one of its worst periods of chaos. https://t.co/Qfob5GtIZz

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 马赫萨-阿米尼（Mahsa Amini）在被警方拘留期间死亡，伊朗当局残酷镇压群众抗议活动，联合国调查人员称，伊朗当局杀害、折磨和强奸妇女、男子和儿童。
item.description:
United Nations investigators say Iranian authorities killed, tortured and raped women, men and children in a brutal repression of mass protests that erupted over the death in police custody of Mahsa Amini. https://t.co/PdzlLacYd2

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 格林纳达警方周四表示，从格林纳达监狱越狱并被指控劫持一对美国夫妇的游艇逃跑的三名男子已被控谋杀。
item.description:
Three men who had escaped from a prison in Grenada and were accused of hijacking an American couple’s yacht to flee have been charged with their murder, the police said on Thursday. https://t.co/d7VXwoPx6s

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 香港官员正争先恐后地通过一项针对叛国和叛乱等政治罪行的法律，其刑罚将严厉到终身监禁。这将赋予他们更大的权力来遏制异见。
item.description:
Officials in Hong Kong are scrambling to pass a law that targets political offenses like treason and insurrection with penalties as harsh as life imprisonment. It would giving them more power to curb dissent. https://t.co/hVEGbArHly

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 美国和乌克兰结成战时同盟已经两年多了，两国之间的纽带正显现出磨损和撕裂的迹象，双方都感到沮丧，感觉两国关系可能陷入了困境。
item.description:
More than two years into their wartime alliance, the bond between the United States and Ukraine is showing signs of wear and tear, giving way to mutual frustration and a feeling that the relationship might be stuck in a bit of a rut. https://t.co/LOKpjho3li

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 新闻分析：对议会选举结果的分析表明，数百万人抵制了投票，极右翼派别取得了惊人的进展，伊朗人对伊朗执政的保守派进行了严厉的抨击。
item.description:
News Analysis: Iranians have delivered a stinging rebuke to Iran’s ruling conservatives, an analysis of parliamentary election results shows, with millions having boycotted the vote and a far-right faction making striking gains. https://t.co/eyNSWlC28P

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 特雷莎-梅是英国前首相，她在唐宁街的任职期间因旷日持久的脱欧之争而伤痕累累，她表示将在下一次大选中离开议会，结束27年的议员生涯。
item.description:
Theresa May, the former British prime minister whose time in Downing Street was scarred by a protracted battle over Brexit, said she would leave Parliament at the next general election after 27 years as a lawmaker. https://t.co/tlILax5XyZ

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 官员们表示，英国和欧盟将与美国一道，为向加沙提供人道主义救援开辟一条海上通道，由西方支持的通过海路向加沙运送急需援助的努力似乎正蓄势待发。
item.description:
Britain and the European Union will join the United States in opening a maritime route for humanitarian relief to Gaza, officials said, as a Western-backed effort to bring urgently needed aid to Gaza by sea appeared to gather momentum.

Follow updates. https://t.co/yDsI3N9ngm

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 龙珠》的创作者、日本著名漫画作家鸟山明去世，享年 68 岁。
item.description:
Akira Toriyama, the creator of “Dragon Ball” and one of Japan’s leading authors of comics, has died at 68. https://t.co/c5VdGVkw5U

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 爱尔兰正在就修改宪法中有关妇女角色和家庭定义的措辞进行全民公决。以下是需要了解的内容。
item.description:
Ireland is voting in referendums about changes to language in its Constitution about the role of women and the definition of family.

Here’s what to know. https://t.co/f7cI5y9DV8

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 迫于北京的压力，香港官员正争先恐后地通过一项搁置已久的国家安全法，该法可对叛国罪等政治罪判处终身监禁，预计此举将进一步压制这个亚洲金融中心的异议人士。
item.description:
Under pressure from Beijing, officials in Hong Kong are scrambling to pass a long-shelved national security law that could impose life imprisonment for political crimes like treason, a move expected to further muzzle dissent in the Asian financial center. https://t.co/pqfKls2Nd5

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 8, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰的筹款人正在大量借鉴商业技巧，让捐款源源不断地流向军方。最新的趋势是什么？金字塔系统。
item.description:
Ukrainian fund-raisers are borrowing heavily from business techniques to keep donations flowing to the military. The latest trend? Pyramid systems. https://t.co/svyiREJsC9

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 7, 2024
